com.cubeia.firebase.api.server
Interface Initializable<C extends Context>

All Known Subinterfaces:
Game, GameActivator, MttActivator, Service
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultActivator, JDBCLoginService
public interface Initializable<C extends Context>

Initializable component. It is guaranteed by its context to be non-reentrant and that its pair of methods will properly mark the component life-cycle. The generic parameter is used to make the initialization context type safe for context subclasses.

Author:
lars.j.nilsson
See Also:
Context

Method Summary
 void destroy()
          Called when the component will no longer be used.
 void init(C con)
          Initialize component.
 

Method Detail

init

void init(C con)
          throws SystemException
Initialize component. Normally, this method will swallow all transient errors. If the component fails hard, and cannot continue it should throw a system exception, for top level components. If this method throws an exception, the component is guaranteed to never be started.

Parameters:
con - Component context, never null
Throws:
SystemException - If the component fails to initialize

destroy

void destroy()
Called when the component will no longer be used.
